author: m.kalinin
content: Are we expecting block explorer to be deployed in the first merge devnet? Any other tools that we'd like to have there, like ethstats?

author: raulj
content: Would be a nice hackathon project to create a small explorer that captures the execution layer blocks vs the consensus blocks being produced

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Faucet would be nice

author: protolambda
content: Not on the first devnet, but definitely time to start integrating it

author: raulj
content: Have a small, goerli faucet that can be repurposed for merge needs here https://github.com/rauljordan/goerli-faucet

author: protolambda
content: We can do a faucet, we'll configure a few accounts in the genesis alloc, then fund a faucet with it (is there one configurable enough to send 32 eth, and avoid users repeating too often?)

author: m.kalinin
content: this would be really great üëç

author: m.kalinin
content: How difficult would it be to re-configure it for the devnet? We aim the first devnet to last for a few days or a week, then it will likely be restarted with new client versions.

author: raulj
content: all it needs is an eth1 http endpoint and the private key where the funds will be sent from. I can work on improving the usage soon too

author: raulj
content: Can add dockerfiles, etc.

author: protolambda
content: Reminder: about 1h 20 min from now we'll do the 2nd rayonism office hours call here in discord.

author: m.kalinin
content: it would be really helpful if you could spend a time on it üëç

author: raulj
content: Great! will keep you guys posted and have it improved early this week

author: m.kalinin
content:
Here is a draft of the first Merge devnet, the main goal now is to specify the scope of the spec that we're focusing in it. https://notes.ethereum.org/@n0ble/rayonism-mergenet-0
The doc references the one that <@!203220829473996800> has recently published about configuring test and dev nets and is heavily based on it.

Mergenet is a stub-name, happy to change it to anything else üôÇ
